main event: An ex-RAF officer observed a brilliant circular object emitting a strong silver light while on board a ship in the North Atlantic on October 5, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as moving quickly and was observed for approximately 1 minute and 45 seconds., The object had an appearance similar to a welding torch's light and was much brighter than a star., The officer's wife and a few other individuals on the ship also saw the object., The object was said to have an estimated speed of 1500 mph and emitted an exhaust., The sighting occurred while the officer was standing on the starboard side of the Cunard Liner Caronia.
sighted object: a brilliant circular object emitting a strong silver light
witness description: An ex-RAF officer, his wife, and a group of onlookers including a member of the ship's orchestra
